intro: Osbeckia brasiliana, commonly known as Brazilian willow or Brazilian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Osbeckia brasiliana has hairy stems and leaves that are often lance-shaped with serrated edges. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
